text: Carol Chaikin is an American jazz instrumentalist and composer. She attended Berklee College of Music. Her eponymous first album was released in 1990 by Gold Castle Records. ==Early life and education== Chaikin was born in Los Angeles. She attended Berklee College of Music, studying flute and alto saxophone under Joe Viola, graduating in 1980. She lived and worked in New York City for sixteen years. She performs with the York Quartet and as a freelance musician in Los Angeles. ==Discography== * Carol Chaikin (Gold Castle, 1990) * Lucy's Day Off (1998) ==References== ==External links== * Official site Category:American female composers Category:American female jazz musicians Category:American jazz alto saxophonists Category:American jazz composers Category:Female jazz composers Category:American jazz flautists Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:Jazz musicians from California Category:Musicians from Los Angeles Category:Musicians from New York City Category:Berklee College of Music alumni Category:20th-century saxophonists Category:20th-century American women musicians Category:20th-century American composers Category:Jazz musicians from New York (state) Category:21st-century saxophonists Category:Female jazz saxophonists Category:21st-century American women musicians Category:20th- century women composers
